Dragalge.Ultra Sun: This vicious Pokémon sprays a poisonous liquid on opponents that come near. For whatever reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.
Dragalge.Ultra Moon: It blends in with seaweed to ambush its prey and then takes them down with a poisonous liquid strong enough to melt metal.

Clauncher.X: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
Clauncher.Omega Ruby: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
Clauncher.Y: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.
Clauncher.Alpha Sapphire: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.
Clauncher.Ultra Sun: Its claws occasionally fall off, and it keeps a low profile until they grow back. The meat of its claws is so delicious!
Clauncher.Ultra Moon: It moves around by jetting water from its right pincer. It has a poor sense of balance, so it's terrible at swimming straight.

Clawitzer.X: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
Clawitzer.Omega Ruby: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
Clawitzer.Y: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.
Clawitzer.Alpha Sapphire: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.
Clawitzer.Ultra Sun: It compresses the water it has sucked up and then projects it with enough power to punch a hole right through a thick sheet of iron.
Clawitzer.Ultra Moon: Its right arm is packed with meat. When its pincer falls off, it's exported to be used as a cooking ingredient.

Helioptile.X: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
Helioptile.Omega Ruby: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
Helioptile.Y: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.
Helioptile.Alpha Sapphire: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

Heliolisk.X: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
Heliolisk.Omega Ruby: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
Heliolisk.Y: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.
Heliolisk.Alpha Sapphire: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

Tyrunt.X: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
Tyrunt.Omega Ruby: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
Tyrunt.Y: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
Tyrunt.Alpha Sapphire: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
Tyrunt.Ultra Sun: Its large jaw has incredible destructive power. Some theories suggest that its restored form is different from its form of long ago.
Tyrunt.Ultra Moon: Tyrunt is spoiled and selfish. It may just be trying to frolic, but sometimes the ones it's trying to frolic with are gravely injured.

Tyrantrum.X: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
Tyrantrum.Omega Ruby: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
Tyrantrum.Y: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.
Tyrantrum.Alpha Sapphire: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.
Tyrantrum.Ultra Sun: Complete restoration is impossible, allowing room for theories that its entire body was once covered in a feather-like coat.
Tyrantrum.Ultra Moon: The king of the ancient world, it can easily crunch a car with the devastating strength of its enormous jaws.

Amaura.X: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
Amaura.Omega Ruby: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
Amaura.Y: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
Amaura.Alpha Sapphire: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
Amaura.Ultra Sun: It lived in cold areas in ancient times. It's said that when Amaura whinnies, auroras appear in the night sky.
Amaura.Ultra Moon: Amaura was restored successfully, but it's not expected to live long because of the heat of the current environment.

Aurorus.X: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
Aurorus.Omega Ruby: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
Aurorus.Y: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack.
Aurorus.Alpha Sapphire: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack.
Aurorus.Ultra Sun: An Aurorus was found frozen solid within a glacier, just as it appeared long ago, which became quite a big event in the news.
Aurorus.Ultra Moon: This usually quiet and kindly Pokémon has a surface temperature of around -240 degrees Fahrenheit.

Sylveon.X: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
Sylveon.Omega Ruby: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
Sylveon.Y: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.
Sylveon.Alpha Sapphire: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.
Sylveon.Sun: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
Sylveon.Moon: When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.
Sylveon.Ultra Sun: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times larger than itself.
Sylveon.Ultra Moon: Sylveon wraps its ribbonlike feelers around its Trainer's arm because this touch enables it to read its Trainer's feelings.

Hawlucha.X: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
Hawlucha.Omega Ruby: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
Hawlucha.Y: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
Hawlucha.Alpha Sapphire: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
Hawlucha.Ultra Sun: It overwhelms opponents with quick moves, but sometimes it showboats for too long when it's using a special move and gets itself into a pinch.
Hawlucha.Ultra Moon: In combat, Hawlucha leaps nimbly about, taking advantage of its opponents' blind spots. It's also skilled at using superb submission holds.

Dedenne.X: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
Dedenne.Omega Ruby: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
Dedenne.Y: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
Dedenne.Alpha Sapphire: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
Dedenne.Ultra Sun: It sneaks into people's homes and steals electricity from their outlets. When your electric bill seems off, it's the handiwork of this rascal.
Dedenne.Ultra Moon: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.

Carbink.X: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
Carbink.Omega Ruby: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
Carbink.Y: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
Carbink.Alpha Sapphire: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
Carbink.Sun: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
Carbink.Moon: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
Carbink.Ultra Sun: Some say that deep beneath the surface of the world, a pack of Carbink live with their queen in a kingdom of jewels.
Carbink.Ultra Moon: To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes to polish one another's jewels.

Goomy.X: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.
Goomy.Omega Ruby: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.
Goomy.Y: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
Goomy.Alpha Sapphire: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
Goomy.Sun: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it's unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
Goomy.Moon: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.
Goomy.Ultra Sun: It uses its horns to check out its surroundings. They're very sensitive, so if you grab them, it will feel a strong shock and be unable to move.
Goomy.Ultra Moon: Its body is mostly water. If it dries out, it will die, so it's always sitting with perfect stillness in the shade.

Sliggoo.X: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.
Sliggoo.Omega Ruby: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.
Sliggoo.Y: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.
Sliggoo.Alpha Sapphire: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.
Sliggoo.Sun: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.
Sliggoo.Moon: This Pokémon's mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they're nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.
Sliggoo.Ultra Sun: It crawls along sluggishly. The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with its brain and other organs.
Sliggoo.Ultra Moon: Its entire body is covered with gooey mucus that can dissolve anything. Be sure to put gloves on if you're going to touch it.

Goodra.X: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
Goodra.Omega Ruby: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
Goodra.Y: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that's the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.
Goodra.Alpha Sapphire: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that's the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.
Goodra.Sun: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
Goodra.Moon: It gets picked on because it's meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.
Goodra.Ultra Sun: It's very friendly toward people. If you grow close to it, Goodra will hug you with its sticky, slime-covered body. Don't get mad.
Goodra.Ultra Moon: Underneath its slimy skin is a thick layer of fat, and the combination of the two makes enemies' attacks slide right off.

Klefki.X: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
Klefki.Omega Ruby: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
Klefki.Y: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
Klefki.Alpha Sapphire: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
Klefki.Sun: This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into people's homes to steal their keys.
Klefki.Moon: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.
Klefki.Ultra Sun: Although it's unclear why it collects keys, giving it a key makes Klefki very happy. However, it apparently only likes master keys.
Klefki.Ultra Moon: Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals that make up its diet became scarcer, Klefki began appearing in human settlements.

Phantump.X: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
Phantump.Omega Ruby: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
Phantump.Y: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
Phantump.Alpha Sapphire: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
Phantump.Sun: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
Phantump.Moon: According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.
Phantump.Ultra Sun: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It's trying to make friends with them.
Phantump.Ultra Moon: An unknown spirit came to lodge in a tree stump, creating this Pokémon. A cure-all can be made from an infusion of its green leaves.

Trevenant.X: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
Trevenant.Omega Ruby: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
Trevenant.Y: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It's kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.
Trevenant.Alpha Sapphire: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It's kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.
Trevenant.Sun: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
Trevenant.Moon: Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell.
Trevenant.Ultra Sun: It's feared as a ghost of the forest. Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which Trevenant hates, when they enter the forest.
Trevenant.Ultra Moon: This Pokémon controls trees via roots stretching from its feet, and it will attack anyone that dares to ravage the forest.

Pumpkaboo.X: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
Pumpkaboo.Omega Ruby: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
Pumpkaboo.Y: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
Pumpkaboo.Alpha Sapphire: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

Gourgeist.X: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
Gourgeist.Omega Ruby: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
Gourgeist.Y: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
Gourgeist.Alpha Sapphire: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

Bergmite.X: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
Bergmite.Omega Ruby: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
Bergmite.Y: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
Bergmite.Alpha Sapphire: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

Avalugg.X: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
Avalugg.Omega Ruby: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
Avalugg.Y: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.
Avalugg.Alpha Sapphire: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

Noibat.X: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
Noibat.Omega Ruby: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
Noibat.Y: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
Noibat.Alpha Sapphire: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
Noibat.Ultra Sun: Fruits are its favorite foods. This gourmet carefully picks out just the ripe ones using its sonar.
Noibat.Ultra Moon: It flies around in search of fruit to eat. It uses ultrasonic waves to detect which fruits are ripe.

Noivern.X: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
Noivern.Omega Ruby: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
Noivern.Y: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
Noivern.Alpha Sapphire: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
Noivern.Ultra Sun: Although it has a violent disposition, if you give it a nice ripe fruit that it loves, Noivern will suddenly become tame.
Noivern.Ultra Moon: This hot-blooded Pokémon attacks anything it sees with ultrasonic waves that can crush boulders.

Xerneas.X: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
Xerneas.Omega Ruby: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
Xerneas.Y: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
Xerneas.Alpha Sapphire: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

Yveltal.X: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
Yveltal.Omega Ruby: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
Yveltal.Y: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
Yveltal.Alpha Sapphire: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

Zygarde.X: When the Kalos region's ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
Zygarde.Omega Ruby: When the Kalos region's ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
Zygarde.Y: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
Zygarde.Alpha Sapphire: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
Zygarde.Sun: This is Zygarde's form when it has gathered 50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.
Zygarde.Moon: It's thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.
Zygarde.Ultra Sun: This is Zygarde's form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.
Zygarde.Ultra Moon: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

Diancie.X: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
Diancie.Omega Ruby: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
Diancie.Y: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
Diancie.Alpha Sapphire: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

Hoopa.X: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.
Hoopa.Y: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.
Hoopa.Omega Ruby: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
Hoopa.Alpha Sapphire: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

Volcanion.X: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
Volcanion.Omega Ruby: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
Volcanion.Y: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
Volcanion.Alpha Sapphire: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

Rowlet.Sun: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
Rowlet.Moon: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
Rowlet.Ultra Sun: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
Rowlet.Ultra Moon: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer's pocket or bag as a nest.

Dartrix.Sun: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
Dartrix.Moon: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
Dartrix.Ultra Sun: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
Dartrix.Ultra Moon: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

Decidueye.Sun: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
Decidueye.Moon: Although basically cool and cautious, when it's caught by surprise, it's seized by panic.
Decidueye.Ultra Sun: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can't afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.
Decidueye.Ultra Moon: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.

Litten.Sun: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
Litten.Moon: It doesn't allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.
Litten.Ultra Sun: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
Litten.Ultra Moon: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.

Torracat.Sun: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
Torracat.Moon: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
Torracat.Ultra Sun: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer's whole body covered in scratches.
Torracat.Ultra Moon: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it's feeling good. When it isn't feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.

Incineroar.Sun: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.
Incineroar.Moon: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.
Incineroar.Ultra Sun: Although it's rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.
Incineroar.Ultra Moon: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.

Popplio.Sun: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.
Popplio.Moon: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
Popplio.Ultra Sun: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
Popplio.Ultra Moon: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It's quite the acrobatic fighter!

Brionne.Sun: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
Brionne.Moon: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.
Brionne.Ultra Sun: It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn't know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.
Brionne.Ultra Moon: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.

Primarina.Sun: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
Primarina.Moon: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon's Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.
Primarina.Ultra Sun: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
Primarina.Ultra Moon: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.

Pikipek.Sun: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
Pikipek.Moon: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.
Pikipek.Ultra Sun: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
Pikipek.Ultra Moon: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

Trumbeak.Sun: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
Trumbeak.Moon: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.
Trumbeak.Ultra Sun: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.
Trumbeak.Ultra Moon: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

Toucannon.Sun: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
Toucannon.Moon: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
Toucannon.Ultra Sun: They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.
Toucannon.Ultra Moon: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

Yungoos.Sun: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
Yungoos.Moon: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.
Yungoos.Ultra Sun: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It's a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.
Yungoos.Ultra Moon: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.

Gumshoos.Sun: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it's always snoozing by nightfall.
Gumshoos.Moon: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it's diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.
Gumshoos.Ultra Sun: Although it wasn't originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.
Gumshoos.Ultra Moon: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal - Rattata!

Grubbin.Sun: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
Grubbin.Moon: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.
Grubbin.Ultra Sun: If you find its nest, you shouldn't stick your hand inside. You'll get bitten by an irritated Grubbin.
Grubbin.Ultra Moon: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.

Charjabug.Sun: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
Charjabug.Moon: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.
Charjabug.Ultra Sun: It buries itself in fallen leaves and barely moves, munching away on humus. If you accidentally step on one, you'll get a shock!
Charjabug.Ultra Moon: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.

Vikavolt.Sun: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
Vikavolt.Moon: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.
Vikavolt.Ultra Sun: It has an organ that generates electricity in its abdomen. It concentrates energy in its strong jaws and fires off powerful jolts of electricity.
Vikavolt.Ultra Moon: Vikavolt flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electric beam attack.

Crabrawler.Sun: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
Crabrawler.Moon: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.
Crabrawler.Ultra Sun: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.
Crabrawler.Ultra Moon: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.

Crabominable.Sun: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
Crabominable.Moon: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.
Crabominable.Ultra Sun: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
Crabominable.Ultra Moon: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.

Oricorio.Sun: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
Oricorio.Moon: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.
Oricorio.Ultra Sun: It wins the hearts of its enemies with its passionate dancing and then uses the opening it creates to burn them up with blazing flames.
Oricorio.Ultra Moon: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.

Cutiefly.Sun: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
Cutiefly.Moon: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
Cutiefly.Ultra Sun: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.
Cutiefly.Ultra Moon: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes' movements and make fools of them.

Ribombee.Sun: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
Ribombee.Moon: Some of Ribombee's pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
Ribombee.Ultra Sun: Rain makes pollen damp, so Ribombee hates rain. When it sees ominous clouds, it finds a hollow in a tree, where it waits stock-still.
Ribombee.Ultra Moon: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.

Rockruff.Sun: It's considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
Rockruff.Moon: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.
Rockruff.Ultra Sun: As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.
Rockruff.Ultra Moon: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!

Lycanroc.Sun: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
Lycanroc.Moon: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.
Lycanroc.Ultra Sun: The sharp rocks in its mane can cut like knives. Lycanroc wears its prey down by degrees before finishing them off.
Lycanroc.Ultra Moon: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.

Wishiwashi.Sun: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
Wishiwashi.Moon: It's awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.
Wishiwashi.Ultra Sun: They're weak, so they move in schools. However, they can also often be seen all alone, having strayed from the school.
Wishiwashi.Ultra Moon: When it's in a jam, its shining eyes attract others of its kind. The light from its eyes is visible almost 25 miles away.

Mareanie.Sun: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
Mareanie.Moon: It's found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.
Mareanie.Ultra Sun: They eat Corsola branches, so Mareanie are hated by craftsmen who work with Corsola branches that have naturally fallen off.
Mareanie.Ultra Moon: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they're cut off. After a good night's sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.

Toxapex.Sun: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
Toxapex.Moon: Those attacked by Toxapex's poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.
Toxapex.Ultra Sun: To attack, this Pokémon sends toxic spikes flying at its enemies. Ones that come close get mown down by the claws on its feet.
Toxapex.Ultra Moon: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn't affect Toxapex in there, so it's very comfortable.

Mudbray.Sun: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
Mudbray.Moon: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.
Mudbray.Ultra Sun: It loves playing in the mud. If it isn't showered with mud on a daily basis, it gets stressed out and stops listening to its Trainer.
Mudbray.Ultra Moon: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.

Mudsdale.Sun: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
Mudsdale.Moon: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.
Mudsdale.Ultra Sun: It remains calm and unmoving no matter the situation. It mixes dirt with the saliva in its mouth to make a special kind of mud.
Mudsdale.Ultra Moon: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.

Dewpider.Sun: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
Dewpider.Moon: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.
Dewpider.Ultra Sun: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.
Dewpider.Ultra Moon: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.

Araquanid.Sun: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
Araquanid.Moon: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.
Araquanid.Ultra Sun: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.
Araquanid.Ultra Moon: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn't watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!

Fomantis.Sun: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
Fomantis.Moon: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.
Fomantis.Ultra Sun: When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.
Fomantis.Ultra Moon: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.

Lurantis.Sun: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis's vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
Lurantis.Moon: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.
Lurantis.Ultra Sun: For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.
Lurantis.Ultra Moon: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it's dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.

Morelull.Sun: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
Morelull.Moon: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
Morelull.Ultra Sun: It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they're dangerous, nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.
Morelull.Ultra Moon: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.

Shiinotic.Sun: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
Shiinotic.Moon: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.
Shiinotic.Ultra Sun: It puts its prey to sleep and siphons off their vitality through the tip of its arms. If one of its kind is weakened, it helps by sending it vitality.
Shiinotic.Ultra Moon: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!

Salandit.Sun: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
Salandit.Moon: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.
Salandit.Ultra Sun: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.
Salandit.Ultra Moon: It weakens opponents and sends them reeling with its poisonous gas. Salandit doesn't deal well with Spinda, since it's always reeling.

Salazzle.Sun: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
Salazzle.Moon: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.
Salazzle.Ultra Sun: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.
Salazzle.Ultra Moon: It punishes Salandit that couldn't bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.

Stufful.Sun: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
Stufful.Moon: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It's an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.
Stufful.Ultra Sun: It boasts power enough to split large trees in half. The organ on its rear releases an odor that it uses to communicate with others of its kind.
Stufful.Ultra Moon: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.

Bewear.Sun: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
Bewear.Moon: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.
Bewear.Ultra Sun: It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn't run away as fast as possible.
Bewear.Ultra Moon: It boasts tremendous physical strength. Many people call it the most dangerous Pokémon in the Alola region.

Bounsweet.Sun: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
Bounsweet.Moon: Although it's too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet's sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.
Bounsweet.Ultra Sun: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it, but it's not intelligent enough to care.
Bounsweet.Ultra Moon: It tries to resist being swallowed by a bird Pokémon by spinning the sepals on its head. It's usually a fruitless attempt.

Steenee.Sun: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
Steenee.Moon: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.
Steenee.Ultra Sun: It's protected by its hard sepals, so it plays with bird Pokémon without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn't care.
Steenee.Ultra Moon: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. They're quite painful when they smack you!

Tsareena.Sun: Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
Tsareena.Moon: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.
Tsareena.Ultra Sun: A master of grand and beautiful kicks, it can knock out even kickboxing champions with a single blow.
Tsareena.Ultra Moon: A Pokémon with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.

Comfey.Sun: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
Comfey.Moon: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.
Comfey.Ultra Sun: It stretches sticky vines out from its head and picks flowers to adorn itself with. When it doesn't have any flowers, it feels uneasy.
Comfey.Ultra Moon: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.

Oranguru.Sun: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best suited to veteran Trainers.
Oranguru.Moon: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
Oranguru.Ultra Sun: It normally spends its time meditating in the treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other Pokémon orders as it pleases.
Oranguru.Ultra Moon: Oranguru don't get along with each other, so they're always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.

Passimian.Sun: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable - they will never let down a comrade.
Passimian.Moon: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.
Passimian.Ultra Sun: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.
Passimian.Ultra Moon: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.

Wimpod.Sun: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
Wimpod.Moon: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.
Wimpod.Ultra Sun: It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.
Wimpod.Ultra Moon: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.

Golisopod.Sun: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater - or even air - right in two.
Golisopod.Moon: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.
Golisopod.Ultra Sun: The shell covering its body is as hard as diamond. This Pokémon will do anything it takes to win.
Golisopod.Ultra Moon: Its claws, which it can extend and retract at will, are its greatest weapons. Golisopod is sometimes accompanied by Wimpod.

Sandygast.Sun: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
Sandygast.Moon: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.
Sandygast.Ultra Sun: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.
Sandygast.Ultra Moon: If you build sand mounds when you're playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.

Palossand.Sun: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
Palossand.Moon: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.
Palossand.Ultra Sun: Each of its grains of sand has its own will. Palossand eats small Pokémon and siphons away their vital essence while they're still alive.
Palossand.Ultra Moon: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.

Pyukumuku.Sun: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
Pyukumuku.Moon: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!
Pyukumuku.Ultra Sun: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.
Pyukumuku.Ultra Moon: Its entire body is covered in its own slime. If you accidentally step on one, you'll slip, and it will get mad and smack you!

Type: Null.Sun: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
Type: Null.Moon: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.
Type: Null.Ultra Sun: A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.
Type: Null.Ultra Moon: There's danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.

Silvally.Sun: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
Silvally.Moon: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.
Silvally.Ultra Sun: This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is greatly increased.
Silvally.Ultra Moon: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.

Minior.Sun: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
Minior.Moon: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.
Minior.Ultra Sun: It lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.
Minior.Ultra Moon: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

Komala.Sun: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
Komala.Moon: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.
Komala.Ultra Sun: It stays asleep from the moment it's born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.
Komala.Ultra Moon: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.

Turtonator.Sun: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
Turtonator.Moon: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.
Turtonator.Ultra Sun: It lives in volcanoes and eats sulfur and other minerals. Materials from the food it eats form the basis of its explosive shell.
Turtonator.Ultra Moon: Its exploding shell poses a real danger but is sensitive to moisture. On rainy days, Turtonator takes silent refuge in caves.

Togedemaru.Sun: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
Togedemaru.Moon: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.
Togedemaru.Ultra Sun: When it's surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.
Togedemaru.Ultra Moon: Its capacity to produce electricity is somewhat limited, so it gets charged up by letting lightning strike it!

Mimikyu.Sun: After going to all the effort of disguising itself, its neck was broken. Whatever is inside is probably unharmed, but it's still feeling sad.
Mimikyu.Moon: If its neck is broken or its rag torn during an attack, it works through the night to patch it.
Mimikyu.Ultra Sun: It stands in front of a mirror, trying to fix its broken neck as if its life depended on it. It has a hard time getting it right, so it's crying inside.
Mimikyu.Ultra Moon: Sad that its true identity may be exposed, Mimikyu will mercilessly seek revenge on any opponent that breaks its neck.

Bruxish.Sun: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
Bruxish.Moon: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.
Bruxish.Ultra Sun: It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.
Bruxish.Ultra Moon: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie's spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.

Drampa.Sun: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
Drampa.Moon: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.
Drampa.Ultra Sun: If a child it has made friends with is bullied, Drampa will find the bully's house and burn it to the ground.
Drampa.Ultra Moon: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they're in danger, so their moms don't have to worry.

Dhelmise.Sun: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
Dhelmise.Moon: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.
Dhelmise.Ultra Sun: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.
Dhelmise.Ultra Moon: Its chain-like green seaweed can stretch outward for hundreds of yards. For some reason, it gets along well with Skrelp.

Jangmo-o.Sun: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
Jangmo-o.Moon: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.
Jangmo-o.Ultra Sun: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.
Jangmo-o.Ultra Moon: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.

Hakamo-o.Sun: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
Hakamo-o.Moon: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they're regrown.
Hakamo-o.Ultra Sun: It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.
Hakamo-o.Ultra Moon: The scales it sheds can be molded and processed to make pots and pans. They conduct heat well, so they're a popular item.

Kommo-o.Sun: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
Kommo-o.Moon: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.
Kommo-o.Ultra Sun: When it howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebrating comrades can be heard from all around.
Kommo-o.Ultra Moon: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.

Tapu Koko.Sun: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
Tapu Koko.Moon: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
Tapu Koko.Ultra Sun: Although it's called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.
Tapu Koko.Ultra Moon: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

Tapu Lele.Sun: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
Tapu Lele.Moon: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.
Tapu Lele.Ultra Sun: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.
Tapu Lele.Ultra Moon: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

Tapu Bulu.Sun: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
Tapu Bulu.Moon: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.
Tapu Bulu.Ultra Sun: Although it's called a guardian deity, it's violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.
Tapu Bulu.Ultra Moon: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula'ula controls plants.

Tapu Fini.Sun: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
Tapu Fini.Moon: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.
Tapu Fini.Ultra Sun: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.
Tapu Fini.Ultra Moon: Although it's called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

Cosmog.Sun: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
Cosmog.Moon: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It's said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.
Cosmog.Ultra Sun: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.
Cosmog.Ultra Moon: Whether or not it's a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it's in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.

Cosmoem.Sun: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
Cosmoem.Moon: There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.
Cosmoem.Ultra Sun: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the "cocoon of the stars" and built an altar to worship it.
Cosmoem.Ultra Moon: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.

Solgaleo.Sun: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
Solgaleo.Moon: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.
Solgaleo.Ultra Sun: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.
Solgaleo.Ultra Moon: In writings from the distant past, it's called by the name "the beast that devours the sun."

Lunala.Sun: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
Lunala.Moon: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
Lunala.Ultra Sun: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name "the beast that calls the moon."
Lunala.Ultra Moon: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.

Nihilego.Sun: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
Nihilego.Moon: One of the Ultra Beasts. It's unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.
Nihilego.Ultra Sun: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
Nihilego.Ultra Moon: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

Buzzwole.Sun: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
Buzzwole.Moon: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.
Buzzwole.Ultra Sun: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
Buzzwole.Ultra Moon: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

Pheromosa.Sun: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
Pheromosa.Moon: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.
Pheromosa.Ultra Sun: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
Pheromosa.Ultra Moon: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

Xurkitree.Sun: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
Xurkitree.Moon: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.
Xurkitree.Ultra Sun: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
Xurkitree.Ultra Moon: They've been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

Celesteela.Sun: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
Celesteela.Moon: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.
Celesteela.Ultra Sun: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
Celesteela.Ultra Moon: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

Kartana.Sun: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
Kartana.Moon: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.
Kartana.Ultra Sun: This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
Kartana.Ultra Moon: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

Guzzlord.Sun: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It's one of the Ultra Beasts.
Guzzlord.Moon: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.
Guzzlord.Ultra Sun: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
Guzzlord.Ultra Moon: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry - it is certainly always devouring something.

Necrozma.Sun: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
Necrozma.Moon: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.
Necrozma.Ultra Sun: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It's apparently from another world.
Necrozma.Ultra Moon: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn't devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.

Magearna.Sun: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
Magearna.Moon: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
Magearna.Ultra Sun: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.
Magearna.Ultra Moon: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

Marshadow.Sun: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
Marshadow.Moon: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.
Marshadow.Ultra Sun: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it's imitating.
Marshadow.Ultra Moon: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.

Poipole.Ultra Sun: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
Poipole.Ultra Moon: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

Naganadel.Ultra Sun: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
Naganadel.Ultra Moon: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

Stakataka.Ultra Sun: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
Stakataka.Ultra Moon: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute's true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

Blacephalon.Ultra Sun: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
Blacephalon.Ultra Moon: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents' surprise to rob them of their vitality.

Zeraora.Ultra Sun: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
Zeraora.Ultra Moon: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

Meltan.Let's Go Pikachu: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
Meltan.Let's Go Eevee: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

Melmetal.Let's Go Pikachu: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
Melmetal.Let's Go Eevee: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
